trans-unit.source: Due to floating point rounding the resulting array may not be Hermitian, the diagonal elements may not be 1, and the elements may not satisfy the inequality abs(a) <= 1. The real and imaginary parts are clipped to the interval [-1, 1] in an attempt to improve on that situation but is not much help in the complex case.
trans-unit.target: Debido al redondeo del punto flotante, la matriz resultante puede no ser hermitiana, los elementos diagonales pueden no ser 1 y los elementos pueden no satisfacer la desigualdad abs (a) <= 1. Las partes real e imaginaria se recortan al intervalo [-1 , 1] en un intento por mejorar esa situación, pero no es de mucha ayuda en el caso complejo.

trans-unit.source: Due to limitations in the interpretation of structured dtypes, dtypes with fields with empty names will have the names replaced by ‘f0’, ‘f1’, etc. Such arrays will not round-trip through the format entirely accurately. The data is intact; only the field names will differ. We are working on a fix for this. This fix will not require a change in the file format. The arrays with such structures can still be saved and restored, and the correct dtype may be restored by using the loadedarray.view(correct_dtype) method.
trans-unit.target: Debido a las limitaciones en la interpretación de dtypes estructurados, los dtypes con campos con nombres vacíos tendrán los nombres reemplazados por 'f0', 'f1', etc. Tales matrices no recorrerán el formato con total precisión. Los datos están intactos; solo los nombres de los campos serán diferentes. Estamos trabajando para solucionar este problema. Esta solución no requerirá un cambio en el formato de archivo. Las matrices con dichas estructuras aún se pueden guardar y restaurar, y el tipo de d correcto se puede restaurar utilizando el loadedarray.view(correct_dtype) .

trans-unit.source: During iteration, you may want to use the index of the current element in a computation. For example, you may want to visit the elements of an array in memory order, but use a C-order, Fortran-order, or multidimensional index to look up values in a different array.
trans-unit.target: Durante la iteración,es posible que desee utilizar el índice del elemento actual en un cálculo.Por ejemplo,tal vez desee visitar los elementos de una matriz en orden de memoria,pero utilizar un índice de orden C,de orden Fortran o multidimensional para buscar valores en una matriz diferente.

During the everyday project activities, council members participate in all discussions, code review and other project activities as peers with all other Contributors and the Community. In these everyday activities, Council Members do not have any special power or privilege through their membership on the Council. However, it is expected that because of the quality and quantity of their contributions and their expert knowledge of the Project Software and Services that Council Members will provide useful guidance, both technical and in terms of project direction, to potentially less experienced contributors.

trans-unit.target: Cada matriz de la tupla tiene la misma forma que la matriz de indices .

trans-unit.target: Cada conjunto debe tener la misma forma.

trans-unit.source: Each boolean array corresponds to a function in funclist. Wherever condlist[i] is True, funclist[i](x) is used as the output value.
trans-unit.target: Cada matriz booleana corresponde a una función en funclist . Siempre que condlist[i] sea ​​True, funclist[i](x) se utiliza como valor de salida.

trans-unit.source: Each boolean array in condlist selects a piece of x, and should therefore be of the same shape as x.
trans-unit.target: Cada matriz booleana en condlist selecciona una parte de x y, por lo tanto, debe tener la misma forma que x .

trans-unit.source: Each built-in data-type has a character code (the updated Numeric typecodes), that uniquely identifies it.
trans-unit.target: Cada tipo de datos incorporado tiene un código de caracteres (los códigos numéricos tipificados actualizados),que lo identifica de manera única.

trans-unit.source: Each differentiation is multiplied by scl. The end result is multiplication by scl**m. This is for use in a linear change of variable. (Default: 1)
trans-unit.target: Cada diferenciación se multiplica por scl . El resultado final es la multiplicación por scl**m . Esto es para usar en un cambio lineal de variable. (Predeterminado: 1)

trans-unit.source: Each dimension in the signature is matched to a dimension of the corresponding passed-in array, starting from the end of the shape tuple.
trans-unit.target: Cada dimensión de la firma se empareja con una dimensión de la correspondiente matriz pasada,comenzando por el final de la tupla de la forma.

trans-unit.source: Each dimension in the signature is matched to a dimension of the corresponding passed-in array, starting from the end of the shape tuple. These are the core dimensions, and they must be present in the arrays, or an error will be raised.
trans-unit.target: Cada dimensión de la firma se corresponde con una dimensión de la correspondiente matriz de paso,empezando por el final de la tupla de la forma.Estas son las dimensiones centrales,y deben estar presentes en los conjuntos,o se producirá un error.

trans-unit.source: Each element of a represents a bit-field that should be unpacked into a binary-valued output array. The shape of the output array is either 1-D (if axis is None) or the same shape as the input array with unpacking done along the axis specified.
trans-unit.target: Cada elemento de a representa un campo de bits que debe descomprimirse en una matriz de salida con valores binarios. La forma de la matriz de salida es 1-D (si el axis es None ) o la misma forma que la matriz de entrada con el desempaquetado realizado a lo largo del eje especificado.

trans-unit.source: Each element of the sum of the ‘ipmt’ and ‘ppmt’ arrays should equal ‘pmt’.
trans-unit.target: Cada elemento de la suma de las matrices 'ipmt' y 'ppmt' debe ser igual a 'pmt'.

trans-unit.source: Each entry in the mymethods array is a PyMethodDef structure containing 1) the Python name, 2) the C-function that implements the function, 3) flags indicating whether or not keywords are accepted for this function, and 4) The docstring for the function. Any number of functions may be defined for a single module by adding more entries to this table. The last entry must be all NULL as shown to act as a sentinel. Python looks for this entry to know that all of the functions for the module have been defined.
Each entry will be the default for the corresponding column

Each function is evaluated over x wherever its corresponding condition is True. It should take a 1d array as input and give an 1d array or a scalar value as output. If, instead of a callable, a scalar is provided then a constant function (lambda x: scalar) is assumed.
trans-unit.target: Cada función se evalúa sobre x siempre que su condición correspondiente sea verdadera. Debe tomar una matriz 1d como entrada y dar una matriz 1d o un valor escalar como salida. Si, en lugar de un invocable, se proporciona un escalar, se supone una función constante ( lambda x: scalar ).

trans-unit.source: Each generalized ufunc has information associated with it that states what the “core” dimensionality of the inputs is, as well as the corresponding dimensionality of the outputs (the element-wise ufuncs have zero core dimensions). The list of the core dimensions for all arguments is called the “signature” of a ufunc. For example, the ufunc numpy.add has signature (),()->() defining two scalar inputs and one scalar output.
trans-unit.target: Cada ufunc generalizada tiene información asociada que establece cuál es la dimensionalidad "central" de las entradas, así como la dimensionalidad correspondiente de las salidas (las ufuncs por elementos tienen dimensiones de núcleo cero). La lista de las dimensiones principales de todos los argumentos se denomina "firma" de una ufunc. Por ejemplo, ufunc numpy.add tiene la firma (),()->() que define dos entradas escalares y una salida escalar.

trans-unit.source: Each item is used as an “op_axes” argument to an nditer
trans-unit.target: Cada elemento se utiliza como un argumento "op_axes" para un nditer

trans-unit.source: Each key can be a column index or a column name, and the corresponding value should be a single object. We can use the special key None to define a default for all columns.
Each line past the first skip_header lines is split at the delimiter character, and characters following the comments character are discarded.
trans-unit.target: Cada línea después de las primeras líneas skip_header se divide en el carácter delimiter y los caracteres que siguen al carácter de comments se descartan.

trans-unit.source: Each module should have a docstring with at least a summary line. Other sections are optional, and should be used in the same order as for documenting functions when they are appropriate:

Each of the arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /, //, %, divmod(), ** or pow(), <<, >>, &, ^, |, ~) and the comparisons (==, <, >, <=, >=, !=) is equivalent to the corresponding universal function (or ufunc for short) in NumPy. For more information, see the section on Universal Functions.

Each of the arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /, //, %, divmod(), ** or pow(), <<, >>, &, ^, |, ~) and the comparisons (==, <, >, <=, >=, !=) is equivalent to the corresponding universal function (or ufunc for short) in NumPy. For more information, see the section on Universal Functions.
trans-unit.target: Cada una de las operaciones aritméticas ( + , - , * , / , // , % , divmod() , ** o pow() , << , >> , & , ^ , | , ~ ) y las comparaciones ( == , < , > , <= , >= , != ) es equivalente a la función universal correspondiente (o ufunc para abreviar) en NumPy. Para obtener más información, consulte la sección sobreFunciones universales .

trans-unit.source: Each of these 12 classes is collected into a unittest.TestSuite, which is then executed. Errors and failures are summed together and returned as the exit argument. Any non-zero result indicates that at least one test did not pass.
trans-unit.target: Cada una de estas 12 clases se recopila en un unittest.TestSuite , que luego se ejecuta. Los errores y los fallos se suman y devuelven como argumento de salida. Cualquier resultado distinto de cero indica que al menos una prueba no pasó.

trans-unit.target: Cada secuencia debe ser de tipo entero o booleano. Las secuencias booleanas se interpretarán como máscaras booleanas para la dimensión correspondiente (equivalente a pasar np.nonzero(boolean_sequence) ).

trans-unit.source: Each tuple has the form (fieldname, datatype, shape) where shape is optional. fieldname is a string (or tuple if titles are used, see Field Titles below), datatype may be any object convertible to a datatype, and shape is a tuple of integers specifying subarray shape.

Each ufunc consists of an elementary function that performs the most basic operation on the smallest portion of array arguments (e.g. adding two numbers is the most basic operation in adding two arrays). The ufunc applies the elementary function multiple times on different parts of the arrays. The input/output of elementary functions can be vectors; e.g., the elementary function of inner1d takes two vectors as input.
trans-unit.target: Cada ufunc consiste en una función elemental que realiza la operación más básica sobre la menor porción de argumentos de los arreglos (por ejemplo,la suma de dos números es la operación más básica en la suma de dos arreglos).La ufunc aplica la función elemental varias veces en diferentes partes de los conjuntos.La entrada/salida de las funciones elementales pueden ser vectores;por ejemplo,la función elemental de inner1d toma dos vectores como entrada.

trans-unit.source: Each universal function takes array inputs and produces array outputs by performing the core function element-wise on the inputs (where an element is generally a scalar, but can be a vector or higher-order sub-array for generalized ufuncs). Standard broadcasting rules are applied so that inputs not sharing exactly the same shapes can still be usefully operated on. Broadcasting can be understood by four rules:
trans-unit.target: Cada función universal toma las entradas de la matriz y produce las salidas de la matriz realizando la función central del elemento en las entradas (donde un elemento es generalmente un escalar,pero puede ser un vector o una submatriz de orden superior para ufunciones generalizadas).Se aplican las normas de radiodifusión estándar de modo que las entradas que no comparten exactamente las mismas formas pueden seguir utilizándose útilmente.La radiodifusión puede entenderse mediante cuatro reglas:

These pointers should each be either NULL or a pointer to an array of integers (terminated by NPY_NOTYPE) indicating data-types that a scalar of this data-type of the specified kind can be cast to safely (this usually means without losing precision).

Either NULL or an array of NPY_NSCALARKINDS pointers. Cada uno de estos punteros debe ser NULL o un puntero a una matriz de enteros (terminados por NPY_NOTYPE ) que indiquen los tipos de datos a los que se puede convertir un escalar de este tipo de datos del tipo especificado de forma segura (esto generalmente significa sin perder precisión).

trans-unit.source: Either NULL or an array of integers (terminated by NPY_NOTYPE ) indicated data-types that this data-type can be cast to safely (this usually means without losing precision).
trans-unit.target: Ya sea NULL o una matriz de enteros (terminados por NPY_NOTYPE ) indicaron tipos de datos a los que este tipo de datos se puede convertir de forma segura (esto generalmente significa sin perder precisión).

trans-unit.source: Either NULL or an array of integers (terminated by NPY_NOTYPE ) indicated data-types that this data-type can be cast to safely (this usually means without losing precision).

Either None to indicate a C-style contiguous array or a Tuple of strides which provides the number of bytes needed to jump to the next array element in the corresponding dimension. Each entry must be an integer (a Python int or long). As with shape, the values may be larger than can be represented by a C “int” or “long”; the calling code should handle this appropriately, either by raising an error, or by using Py_LONG_LONG in C. The default is None which implies a C-style contiguous memory buffer. In this model, the last dimension of the array varies the fastest. For example, the default strides tuple for an object whose array entries are 8 bytes long and whose shape is (10,20,30) would be (4800, 240, 8)
trans-unit.target: De cualquier None para indicar una gama contigua de estilo C o una tupla de pasos que proporciona el número de bytes necesarios para saltar al siguiente elemento de la matriz en la dimensión correspondiente. Cada entrada debe ser un número entero (un Python int o long ). Al igual que con la forma, los valores pueden ser mayores de lo que se puede representar con una C "int" o "long"; el código de llamada debe manejar esto apropiadamente, ya sea generando un error o usando Py_LONG_LONG en C. El valor predeterminado es None que implica un búfer de memoria contiguo estilo C. En este modelo, la última dimensión de la matriz varía más rápidamente. Por ejemplo, la tupla de pasos predeterminada para un objeto cuyas entradas de matriz tienen 8 bytes de longitud y cuya forma es (10,20,30) sería (4800, 240, 8)

trans-unit.source: Either PyUFunc_One, PyUFunc_Zero, PyUFunc_None or PyUFunc_AllOnes to indicate the identity for this operation. It is only used for a reduce-like call on an empty array.
trans-unit.target: Puede ser PyUFunc_One , PyUFunc_Zero , PyUFunc_None o PyUFunc_AllOnes para indicar la identidad de esta operación. Solo se usa para una llamada similar a reducir en una matriz vacía.

trans-unit.source: Either None to indicate a C-style contiguous array or a Tuple of strides which provides the number of bytes needed to jump to the next array element in the corresponding dimension. Each entry must be an integer (a Python int or long). As with shape, the values may be larger than can be represented by a C “int” or “long”; the calling code should handle this appropriately, either by raising an error, or by using Py_LONG_LONG in C. The default is None which implies a C-style contiguous memory buffer. In this model, the last dimension of the array varies the fastest. For example, the default strides tuple for an object whose array entries are 8 bytes long and whose shape is (10,20,30) would be (4800, 240, 8)
Either a basic-type description string as in typestr or another list (for nested structured types)
trans-unit.target: Ya sea una cadena de descripción de tipo básico como en typetr u otra lista (para tipos estructurados anidados)

trans-unit.source: Either a data-type, a tuple of data-types, or a special signature string indicating the input and output types of a ufunc. This argument allows you to provide a specific signature for the 1-d loop to use in the underlying calculation. If the loop specified does not exist for the ufunc, then a TypeError is raised. Normally, a suitable loop is found automatically by comparing the input types with what is available and searching for a loop with data-types to which all inputs can be cast safely. This keyword argument lets you bypass that search and choose a particular loop. A list of available signatures is provided by the types attribute of the ufunc object. For backwards compatibility this argument can also be provided as sig, although the long form is preferred. Note that this should not be confused with the generalized ufunc signature that is stored in the signature attribute of the of the ufunc object.
trans-unit.target: Ya sea un tipo de datos, una tupla de tipos de datos o una cadena de firma especial que indica los tipos de entrada y salida de un ufunc. Este argumento le permite proporcionar una firma específica para que el bucle 1-d la utilice en el cálculo subyacente. Si el bucle especificado no existe para ufunc, se genera un TypeError. Normalmente, un bucle adecuado se encuentra automáticamente comparando los tipos de entrada con lo que está disponible y buscando un bucle con tipos de datos a los que todas las entradas se puedan enviar de forma segura. Este argumento de palabra clave le permite omitir esa búsqueda y elegir un bucle en particular. El atributo de tipos del objeto ufunc proporciona una lista de firmas disponibles . Para compatibilidad con versiones anteriores, este argumento también se puede proporcionar como sig, aunque se prefiere la forma larga. Tenga en cuenta que esto no debe confundirse con la firma ufunc generalizada que se almacena en el atributo de firma del objeto ufunc.

trans-unit.source: Either a data-type, a tuple of data-types, or a special signature string indicating the input and output types of a ufunc. This argument allows you to provide a specific signature for the 1-d loop to use in the underlying calculation. If the loop specified does not exist for the ufunc, then a TypeError is raised. Normally, a suitable loop is found automatically by comparing the input types with what is available and searching for a loop with data-types to which all inputs can be cast safely. This keyword argument lets you bypass that search and choose a particular loop. A list of available signatures is provided by the types attribute of the ufunc object. For backwards compatibility this argument can also be provided as sig, although the long form is preferred. Note that this should not be confused with the generalized ufunc signature that is stored in the signature attribute of the of the ufunc object.
Either passing n arguments as in njoin(‘a’,’b’), or a sequence of n names as in njoin([‘a’,’b’]) is handled, or a mixture of such arguments.

Element index to partition by. The k-th element will be in its final sorted position and all smaller elements will be moved before it and all larger elements behind it. The order all elements in the partitions is undefined. If provided with a sequence of k-th it will partition all of them into their sorted position at once.
trans-unit.target: Índice de elementos para la partición por.El k-ésimo elemento estará en su posición final ordenada y todos los elementos más pequeños se moverán delante de él y todos los elementos más grandes detrás de él.El orden de todos los elementos en las particiones no está definido.Si se le proporciona una secuencia de k-ésima,los dividirá a todos en su posición ordenada de una sola vez.

trans-unit.source: Element index to partition by. The k-th value of the element will be in its final sorted position and all smaller elements will be moved before it and all equal or greater elements behind it. The order of all elements in the partitions is undefined. If provided with a sequence of k-th it will partition all elements indexed by k-th of them into their sorted position at once.
trans-unit.target: Índice de elementos para la partición por.El valor k-ésimo del elemento estará en su posición final ordenada y todos los elementos más pequeños se moverán delante de él y todos los elementos iguales o mayores detrás de él.El orden de todos los elementos en las particiones no está definido.Si se le proporciona una secuencia de k-ésimo partirá todos los elementos indexados por k-ésimo de ellos en su posición ordenada a la vez.

trans-unit.source: Element index to partition by. The kth element value will be in its final sorted position and all smaller elements will be moved before it and all equal or greater elements behind it. The order of all elements in the partitions is undefined. If provided with a sequence of kth it will partition all elements indexed by kth of them into their sorted position at once.
trans-unit.target: Índice de elementos para la partición por.El valor kth del elemento estará en su posición final ordenada y todos los elementos más pequeños se moverán delante de él y todos los elementos iguales o mayores detrás de él.El orden de todos los elementos en las particiones no está definido.Si se le proporciona una secuencia de kth,particionará todos los elementos indexados por kth de ellos en su posición ordenada a la vez.

Emphasize empathy for individuals rather than judging behavior, avoiding binary labels of “good” and “bad/evil”. Overt, clear-cut aggression and harassment exists and we will be address that firmly. But many scenarios that can prove challenging to resolve are those where normal disagreements devolve into unhelpful or harmful behavior from multiple parties. Understanding the full context and finding a path that re-engages all is hard, but ultimately the most productive for our community.

trans-unit.source: Encapsulate the functionality of functions and methods that take the axis= keyword and work properly with None as the axis argument. The input array is obj, while *axis is a converted integer (so that >=MAXDIMS is the None value), and requirements gives the needed properties of obj. The output is a converted version of the input so that requirements are met and if needed a flattening has occurred. On output negative values of *axis are converted and the new value is checked to ensure consistency with the shape of obj.
trans-unit.target: Encapsule la funcionalidad de funciones y métodos que toman la palabra clave axis = y funcionan correctamente con None como argumento del eje. La matriz de entrada es obj , mientras que *axis es un entero convertido (de modo que> = MAXDIMS es el valor None), y los requirements dan las propiedades necesarias de obj . La salida es una versión convertida de la entrada para que se cumplan los requisitos y, si es necesario, se produzca un aplanamiento. En la salida, los valores negativos del *axis se convierten y el nuevo valor se verifica para garantizar la coherencia con la forma de obj .

trans-unit.source: Encoding used to decode the inputfile. Does not apply to input streams. The special value ‘bytes’ enables backward compatibility workarounds that ensures you receive byte arrays as results if possible and passes ‘latin1’ encoded strings to converters. Override this value to receive unicode arrays and pass strings as input to converters. If set to None the system default is used. The default value is ‘bytes’.

El valor especial 'bytes' habilita soluciones alternativas de compatibilidad con versiones anteriores que aseguran que reciba matrices de bytes como resultados, si es posible, y pasa cadenas codificadas en 'latin1' a los convertidores. Anule este valor para recibir matrices Unicode y pasar cadenas como entrada a los convertidores. Si se establece en Ninguno, se utiliza el valor predeterminado del sistema. El valor predeterminado es 'bytes'.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.all (self, axis). Return an array with True elements for every 1-d sub-array of self defined by axis in which all the elements are True.
Equivalent to ndarray.any (self, axis). Return an array with True elements for every 1-d sub-array of self defined by axis in which any of the elements are True.
Equivalent to ndarray.argmax (self, axis). Return the index of the largest element of self along axis.
Equivalent to ndarray.argmin (self, axis). Return the index of the smallest element of self along axis.
Equivalent to ndarray.argpartition (self, ktharray, axis, kind). Return an array of indices such that selection of these indices along the given axis would return a partitioned version of self.

Equivalent to ndarray.argsort (self, axis). Return an array of indices such that selection of these indices along the given axis would return a sorted version of self. If self ->descr is a data-type with fields defined, then self->descr->names is used to determine the sort order. A comparison where the first field is equal will use the second field and so on. To alter the sort order of a structured array, create a new data-type with a different order of names and construct a view of the array with that new data-type.

Equivalent to ndarray.byteswap (self, inplace). Return an array whose data area is byteswapped. If inplace is non-zero, then do the byteswap inplace and return a reference to self. Otherwise, create a byteswapped copy and leave self unchanged.

Equivalent to ndarray.choose (self, op, ret, clipmode). Create a new array by selecting elements from the sequence of arrays in op based on the integer values in self. The arrays must all be broadcastable to the same shape and the entries in self should be between 0 and len(op). The output is placed in ret unless it is NULL in which case a new output is created. The clipmode argument determines behavior for when entries in self are not between 0 and len(op).
Equivalent to ndarray.clip (self, min, max). Clip an array, self, so that values larger than max are fixed to max and values less than min are fixed to min.
Equivalent to ndarray.compress (self, condition, axis ). Return the elements along axis corresponding to elements of condition that are true.
Equivalent to ndarray.conjugate (self). Return the complex conjugate of self. If self is not of complex data type, then return self with a reference.

Equivalent to ndarray.copy (self, fortran). Make a copy of the old array. The returned array is always aligned and writeable with data interpreted the same as the old array. If order is NPY_CORDER, then a C-style contiguous array is returned. If order is NPY_FORTRANORDER, then a Fortran-style contiguous array is returned. If order isNPY_ANYORDER, then the array returned is Fortran-style contiguous only if the old one is; otherwise, it is C-style contiguous.
Equivalent to ndarray.cumprod (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d cumulative products of elements in self along axis. Perform the product after converting data to data type rtype.
Equivalent to ndarray.cumsum (self, axis, rtype). Return cumulative 1-d sums of elements in self along axis. Perform the sum after converting data to data type rtype.
Equivalent to ndarray.diagonal (self, offset, axis1, axis2 ). Return the offset diagonals of the 2-d arrays defined by axis1 and axis2.

Equivalent to ndarray.flatten (self, order). Return a 1-d copy of the array. If order is NPY_FORTRANORDER the elements are scanned out in Fortran order (first-dimension varies the fastest). If order is NPY_CORDER, the elements of self are scanned in C-order (last dimension varies the fastest). If orderNPY_ANYORDER, then the result of PyArray_ISFORTRAN (self) is used to determine which order to flatten.

Equivalent to ndarray.getfield (self, dtype, offset). This function steals a reference to PyArray_Descr and returns a new array of the given dtype using the data in the current array at a specified offset in bytes. The offset plus the itemsize of the new array type must be less than self ->descr->elsize or an error is raised. The same shape and strides as the original array are used. Therefore, this function has the effect of returning a field from a structured array. But, it can also be used to select specific bytes or groups of bytes from any array type.
Equivalent to ndarray.max (self, axis). Returns the largest element of self along the given axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.

Equivalent to ndarray.mean (self, axis, rtype). Returns the mean of the elements along the given axis, using the enumerated type rtype as the data type to sum in. Default sum behavior is obtained using NPY_NOTYPE for rtype.
Equivalent to ndarray.min (self, axis). Return the smallest element of self along the given axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.

Equivalent to ndarray.nonzero (self). Returns a tuple of index arrays that select elements of self that are nonzero. If (nd= PyArray_NDIM ( self ))==1, then a single index array is returned. The index arrays have data type NPY_INTP. If a tuple is returned (nd

Equivalent to ndarray.partition (self, ktharray, axis, kind). Partitions the array so that the values of the element indexed by ktharray are in the positions they would be if the array is fully sorted and places all elements smaller than the kth before and all elements equal or greater after the kth element. The ordering of all elements within the partitions is undefined. If self->descr is a data-type with fields defined, then self->descr->names is used to determine the sort order. A comparison where the first field is equal will use the second field and so on. To alter the sort order of a structured array, create a new data-type with a different order of names and construct a view of the array with that new data-type. Returns zero on success and -1 on failure.
Equivalent to ndarray.prod (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d products of elements in self along axis. Perform the product after converting data to data type rtype.

Equivalent to ndarray.ptp (self, axis). Return the difference between the largest element of self along axis and the smallest element of self along axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.

Equivalent to ndarray.repeat (self, op, axis). Copy the elements of self, op times along the given axis. Either op is a scalar integer or a sequence of length self ->dimensions[ axis ] indicating how many times to repeat each item along the axis.
Equivalent to ndarray.reshape (self, shape) where shape is a sequence. Converts shape to a PyArray_Dims structure and calls PyArray_Newshape internally. For back-ward compatibility – Not recommended

Equivalent to ndarray.resize (self, newshape, refcheck =refcheck, order= fortran ). This function only works on single-segment arrays. It changes the shape of self inplace and will reallocate the memory for self if newshape has a different total number of elements then the old shape. If reallocation is necessary, then self must own its data, have self - >base==NULL, have self - >weakrefs==NULL, and (unless refcheck is 0) not be referenced by any other array. The fortran argument can be NPY_ANYORDER, NPY_CORDER, or NPY_FORTRANORDER. It currently has no effect. Eventually it could be used to determine how the resize operation should view the data when constructing a differently-dimensioned array. Returns None on success and NULL on error.
Equivalent to ndarray.round (self, decimals, out). Returns the array with elements rounded to the nearest decimal place. The decimal place is defined as the

Equivalent to ndarray.searchsorted (self, values, side, perm). Assuming self is a 1-d array in ascending order, then the output is an array of indices the same shape as values such that, if the elements in values were inserted before the indices, the order of self would be preserved. No checking is done on whether or not self is in ascending order.

Equivalent to ndarray.setfield (self, val, dtype, offset ). Set the field starting at offset in bytes and of the given dtype to val. The offset plus dtype ->elsize must be less than self ->descr->elsize or an error is raised. Otherwise, the val argument is converted to an array and copied into the field pointed to. If necessary, the elements of val are repeated to fill the destination array, But, the number of elements in the destination must be an integer multiple of the number of elements in val.

Equivalent to ndarray.sort (self, axis, kind). Return an array with the items of self sorted along axis. The array is sorted using the algorithm denoted by kind, which is an integer/enum pointing to the type of sorting algorithms used.
Equivalent to ndarray.squeeze (self). Return a new view of self with all of the dimensions of length 1 removed from the shape.
Equivalent to ndarray.std (self, axis, rtype). Return the standard deviation using data along axis converted to data type rtype.
Equivalent to ndarray.sum (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d vector sums of elements in self along axis. Perform the sum after converting data to data type rtype.
Equivalent to ndarray.swapaxes (self, a1, a2). The returned array is a new view of the data in self with the given axes, a1 and a2, swapped.

Equivalent to ndarray.take (self, indices, axis, ret, clipmode) except axis =None in Python is obtained by setting axis = NPY_MAXDIMS in C. Extract the items from self indicated by the integer-valued indices along the given axis. The clipmode argument can be NPY_RAISE, NPY_WRAP, or NPY_CLIP to indicate what to do with out-of-bound indices. The ret argument can specify an output array rather than having one created internally.
Equivalent to ndarray.tobytes (self, order). Return the bytes of this array in a Python string.
Equivalent to ndarray.tolist (self). Return a nested Python list from self.

Equivalent to ndarray.trace (self, offset, axis1, axis2, rtype). Return the sum (using rtype as the data type of summation) over the offset diagonal elements of the 2-d arrays defined by axis1 and axis2 variables. A positive offset chooses diagonals above the main diagonal. A negative offset selects diagonals below the main diagonal.

Equivalent to ndarray.transpose (self, permute). Permute the axes of the ndarray object self according to the data structure permute and return the result. If permute is NULL, then the resulting array has its axes reversed. For example if self has shape
Equivalent to ndarray.view (self, dtype). Return a new view of the array self as possibly a different data-type, dtype, and different array subclass ptype.
Equivalent to ndarray.all (self, axis). Return an array with True elements for every 1-d sub-array of self defined by axis in which all the elements are True.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.all ( self , axis ). Devuelve una matriz con elementos True para cada submatriz 1-d de self por axis en la que todos los elementos son True.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.any (self, axis). Return an array with True elements for every 1-d sub-array of self defined by axis in which any of the elements are True.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.any ( self , axis ). Devuelve una matriz con elementos Verdaderos para cada submatriz 1-d de autodefinido por eje en el que cualquiera de los elementos sea Verdadero.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.argmax (self, axis). Return the index of the largest element of self along axis.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.argmax ( self , axis ). Devuelve el índice del elemento más grande de uno mismo a lo largo del eje .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.argmin (self, axis). Return the index of the smallest element of self along axis.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.argmin ( self , axis ). Devuelve el índice del elemento más pequeño de self a lo largo del eje .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.argpartition (self, ktharray, axis, kind). Return an array of indices such that selection of these indices along the given axis would return a partitioned version of self.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.argpartition ( self , ktharray , axis , kind ). Devuelve una matriz de índices de modo que la selección de estos índices a lo largo del axis dado devolvería una versión particionada de self .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.argsort (self, axis). Return an array of indices such that selection of these indices along the given axis would return a sorted version of self. If self ->descr is a data-type with fields defined, then self->descr->names is used to determine the sort order. A comparison where the first field is equal will use the second field and so on. To alter the sort order of a structured array, create a new data-type with a different order of names and construct a view of the array with that new data-type.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.argsort ( self , axis ). Devuelve una matriz de índices de modo que la selección de estos índices a lo largo del axis dado devolvería una versión ordenada de self . Si self -> descr es un tipo de datos con campos definidos, se usa self-> descr-> names para determinar el orden de clasificación. Una comparación donde el primer campo es igual utilizará el segundo campo y así sucesivamente. Para alterar el orden de clasificación de una matriz estructurada, cree un nuevo tipo de datos con un orden diferente de nombres y construya una vista de la matriz con ese nuevo tipo de datos.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.byteswap (self, inplace). Return an array whose data area is byteswapped. If inplace is non-zero, then do the byteswap inplace and return a reference to self. Otherwise, create a byteswapped copy and leave self unchanged.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.byteswap ( self , inplace ). Devuelve una matriz cuyo área de datos está intercambiada en bytes. Si inplace no es cero, entonces haga el bytewap inplace y devuelva una referencia a self. De lo contrario, cree una copia con intercambio de bytes y no la modifique.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.choose (self, op, ret, clipmode). Create a new array by selecting elements from the sequence of arrays in op based on the integer values in self. The arrays must all be broadcastable to the same shape and the entries in self should be between 0 and len(op). The output is placed in ret unless it is NULL in which case a new output is created. The clipmode argument determines behavior for when entries in self are not between 0 and len(op).
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.choose ( self , op , ret , clipmode ). Cree una nueva matriz seleccionando elementos de la secuencia de matrices en op en función de los valores enteros en self . Todas las matrices deben ser ampliables a la misma forma y las entradas en self deben estar entre 0 y len ( op ). La salida se coloca en ret a menos que sea NULL , en cuyo caso se crea una nueva salida. El argumento clipmode determina el comportamiento cuando las entradas en self no están entre 0 y len ( op ).

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.clip (self, min, max). Clip an array, self, so that values larger than max are fixed to max and values less than min are fixed to min.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.clip ( self , min , max ). Recorte una matriz, self , de modo que los valores superiores a max se fijen en max y los valores inferiores a min se fijen en min .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.compress (self, condition, axis ). Return the elements along axis corresponding to elements of condition that are true.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.compress ( self , condition , axis ). Devuelve los elementos a lo largo del eje correspondientes a los elementos de condición que son verdaderos.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.conjugate (self). Return the complex conjugate of self. If self is not of complex data type, then return self with a reference.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.conjugate ( self ). Devuelve el complejo conjugado del yo . Si self no es de un tipo de datos complejo, devuelva self con una referencia.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.copy (self, fortran). Make a copy of the old array. The returned array is always aligned and writeable with data interpreted the same as the old array. If order is NPY_CORDER, then a C-style contiguous array is returned. If order is NPY_FORTRANORDER, then a Fortran-style contiguous array is returned. If order isNPY_ANYORDER, then the array returned is Fortran-style contiguous only if the old one is; otherwise, it is C-style contiguous.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.copy ( self , fortran ). Haga una copia de la vieja matriz. La matriz devuelta siempre está alineada y se puede escribir con datos interpretados de la misma manera que la matriz anterior. Si el pedido es NPY_CORDER , se devuelve una matriz contigua de estilo C. Si el orden es NPY_FORTRANORDER , se devuelve una matriz contigua al estilo Fortran. Si el orden es NPY_ANYORDER , entonces la matriz devuelta es contigua al estilo Fortran solo si la anterior lo es; de lo contrario, es contiguo al estilo C.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.cumprod (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d cumulative products of elements in self along axis. Perform the product after converting data to data type rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.cumprod ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve productos acumulativos 1-d de elementos en self a lo largo del axis . Realice el producto después de convertir los datos al tipo de datos rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.cumsum (self, axis, rtype). Return cumulative 1-d sums of elements in self along axis. Perform the sum after converting data to data type rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.cumsum ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve sumas 1-d acumulativas de elementos en self a lo largo del eje . Realice la suma después de convertir los datos al tipo de datos rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.diagonal (self, offset, axis1, axis2 ). Return the offset diagonals of the 2-d arrays defined by axis1 and axis2.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.diagonal ( self , offset , axis1 , axis2 ). Devuelve las diagonales de desplazamiento de las matrices 2-d definidas por axis1 y axis2 .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.flatten (self, order). Return a 1-d copy of the array. If order is NPY_FORTRANORDER the elements are scanned out in Fortran order (first-dimension varies the fastest). If order is NPY_CORDER, the elements of self are scanned in C-order (last dimension varies the fastest). If orderNPY_ANYORDER, then the result of PyArray_ISFORTRAN (self) is used to determine which order to flatten.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.flatten ( self , order ). Devuelve una copia 1-d de la matriz. Si el orden es NPY_FORTRANORDER , los elementos se escanean en orden Fortran (la primera dimensión varía más rápidamente). Si el orden es NPY_CORDER , los elementos de self se escanean en orden C (la última dimensión varía más rápidamente). Si orden NPY_ANYORDER , entonces el resultado de PyArray_ISFORTRAN ( self ) se usa para determinar qué orden aplanar.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.getfield (self, dtype, offset). This function steals a reference to PyArray_Descr and returns a new array of the given dtype using the data in the current array at a specified offset in bytes. The offset plus the itemsize of the new array type must be less than self ->descr->elsize or an error is raised. The same shape and strides as the original array are used. Therefore, this function has the effect of returning a field from a structured array. But, it can also be used to select specific bytes or groups of bytes from any array type.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.getfield ( self , dtype , offset ). Esta función roba una referencia a PyArray_Descr y devuelve una nueva matriz del tipo dtype dado utilizando los datos de la matriz actual en un offset especificado en bytes. El offset más el tamaño del elemento del nuevo tipo de matriz debe ser menor que self ->descr->elsize o se generará un error. Se utilizan la misma forma y zancadas que la matriz original. Por lo tanto, esta función tiene el efecto de devolver un campo de una matriz estructurada. Pero también se puede utilizar para seleccionar bytes específicos o grupos de bytes de cualquier tipo de matriz.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.max (self, axis). Returns the largest element of self along the given axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.max ( self , axis ). Devuelve el elemento más grande de uno mismo a lo largo del eje dado . Cuando el resultado es un solo elemento, devuelve un escalar numpy en lugar de un ndarray.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.mean (self, axis, rtype). Returns the mean of the elements along the given axis, using the enumerated type rtype as the data type to sum in. Default sum behavior is obtained using NPY_NOTYPE for rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.mean ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve la media de los elementos a lo largo del eje dado , utilizando el tipo enumerado rtype como el tipo de datos para sumar. El comportamiento de suma predeterminado se obtiene utilizando NPY_NOTYPE para rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.min (self, axis). Return the smallest element of self along the given axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.min ( self , axis ). Devuelve el elemento más pequeño de uno mismo a lo largo del eje dado . Cuando el resultado es un solo elemento, devuelve un escalar numpy en lugar de un ndarray.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.nonzero (self). Returns a tuple of index arrays that select elements of self that are nonzero. If (nd= PyArray_NDIM ( self ))==1, then a single index array is returned. The index arrays have data type NPY_INTP. If a tuple is returned (nd
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.nonzero ( self ). Devuelve una tupla de matrices de índices que seleccionan elementos de self que son distintos de cero. Si (nd = PyArray_NDIM ( self )) == 1, se devuelve una única matriz de índice. Las matrices de índices tienen el tipo de datos NPY_INTP . Si se devuelve una tupla (nd

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.partition (self, ktharray, axis, kind). Partitions the array so that the values of the element indexed by ktharray are in the positions they would be if the array is fully sorted and places all elements smaller than the kth before and all elements equal or greater after the kth element. The ordering of all elements within the partitions is undefined. If self->descr is a data-type with fields defined, then self->descr->names is used to determine the sort order. A comparison where the first field is equal will use the second field and so on. To alter the sort order of a structured array, create a new data-type with a different order of names and construct a view of the array with that new data-type. Returns zero on success and -1 on failure.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.partition ( self , ktharray , axis , kind ). Divide la matriz para que los valores del elemento indexado por ktharray estén en las posiciones que estarían si la matriz estuviera completamente ordenada y coloque todos los elementos más pequeños que el kth antes y todos los elementos iguales o mayores después del kth elemento. El orden de todos los elementos dentro de las particiones no está definido. Si yo-> descr es un tipo de datos con campos definidos, luego self-> descr-> names se usa para determinar el orden de clasificación. Una comparación donde el primer campo es igual utilizará el segundo campo y así sucesivamente. Para alterar el orden de clasificación de una matriz estructurada, cree un nuevo tipo de datos con un orden diferente de nombres y construya una vista de la matriz con ese nuevo tipo de datos. Devuelve cero en caso de éxito y -1 en caso de fracaso.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.prod (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d products of elements in self along axis. Perform the product after converting data to data type rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.prod ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve productos 1-d de elementos en uno mismo a lo largo del eje . Realice el producto después de convertir los datos al tipo de datos rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.ptp (self, axis). Return the difference between the largest element of self along axis and the smallest element of self along axis. When the result is a single element, returns a numpy scalar instead of an ndarray.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.ptp ( self , axis ). Devuelve la diferencia entre el elemento más grande de uno mismo a lo largo del eje y el elemento más pequeño de uno mismo a lo largo del eje . Cuando el resultado es un solo elemento, devuelve un escalar numpy en lugar de un ndarray.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.repeat (self, op, axis). Copy the elements of self, op times along the given axis. Either op is a scalar integer or a sequence of length self ->dimensions[ axis ] indicating how many times to repeat each item along the axis.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.repeat ( self , op , axis ). Copie los elementos de self , op times a lo largo del eje dado . O op es un entero escalar o una secuencia de longitud self -> dimensiones [ eje ] que indica cuántas veces se debe repetir cada elemento a lo largo del eje.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.reshape (self, shape) where shape is a sequence. Converts shape to a PyArray_Dims structure and calls PyArray_Newshape internally. For back-ward compatibility – Not recommended
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.reshape ( self , shape ) donde shape es una secuencia. Convierte la forma en una estructura PyArray_Dims y llama a PyArray_Newshape internamente. Para compatibilidad con versiones anteriores: no recomendado

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.resize (self, newshape, refcheck =refcheck, order= fortran ). This function only works on single-segment arrays. It changes the shape of self inplace and will reallocate the memory for self if newshape has a different total number of elements then the old shape. If reallocation is necessary, then self must own its data, have self - >base==NULL, have self - >weakrefs==NULL, and (unless refcheck is 0) not be referenced by any other array. The fortran argument can be NPY_ANYORDER, NPY_CORDER, or NPY_FORTRANORDER. It currently has no effect. Eventually it could be used to determine how the resize operation should view the data when constructing a differently-dimensioned array. Returns None on success and NULL on error.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.resize ( self , newshape , refcheck = refcheck , order = fortran). Esta función solo funciona en matrices de un solo segmento. Cambia la forma de sí mismo en su lugar y reasignará la memoria para sí mismo si la nueva forma tiene un número total de elementos diferente al de la forma anterior. Si la reasignación es necesaria, entonces self debe poseer sus datos, tener self - >base==NULL , tener self - >weakrefs==NULL , y (a menos que refcheck sea 0) no ser referenciado por ninguna otra matriz. El argumento NPY_ANYORDER puede ser NPY_ANYORDER, NPY_CORDER o NPY_FORTRANORDER . Actualmente no tiene ningún efecto. Eventualmente, podría usarse para determinar cómo la operación de cambio de tamaño debe ver los datos al construir una matriz de diferentes dimensiones. Devuelve None en caso de éxito y NULL en caso de error.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.round (self, decimals, out). Returns the array with elements rounded to the nearest decimal place. The decimal place is defined as the
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.round ( self , decimales , out ). Devuelve la matriz con elementos redondeados al decimal más cercano. El lugar decimal se define como el

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.searchsorted (self, values, side, perm). Assuming self is a 1-d array in ascending order, then the output is an array of indices the same shape as values such that, if the elements in values were inserted before the indices, the order of self would be preserved. No checking is done on whether or not self is in ascending order.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.searchsorted ( self , values , side , permanente ). Suponiendo que self es una matriz 1-d en orden ascendente, entonces la salida es una matriz de índices con la misma forma que los valores, de modo que, si los elementos en los valores se insertan antes de los índices, se conservaría el orden de self . No se comprueba si el yo está en orden ascendente o no.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.setfield (self, val, dtype, offset ). Set the field starting at offset in bytes and of the given dtype to val. The offset plus dtype ->elsize must be less than self ->descr->elsize or an error is raised. Otherwise, the val argument is converted to an array and copied into the field pointed to. If necessary, the elements of val are repeated to fill the destination array, But, the number of elements in the destination must be an integer multiple of the number of elements in val.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.setfield ( self , val , dtype , offset ). Establezca el campo que comienza en el desplazamiento en bytes y del tipo d dado en val . El desplazamiento más dtype -> elsize debe ser menor que self -> descr-> elsize o se generará un error. De lo contrario, el argumento val se convierte en una matriz y se copia en el campo al que se apunta. Si es necesario, los elementos de val se repiten para llenar la matriz de destino, pero el número de elementos en el destino debe ser un múltiplo entero del número de elementos enval .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.sort (self, axis, kind). Return an array with the items of self sorted along axis. The array is sorted using the algorithm denoted by kind , which is an integer/enum pointing to the type of sorting algorithms used.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.sort ( self , axis , kind ). Devuelve una matriz con los elementos de auto ordenados a lo largo del eje . La matriz se ordena utilizando el algoritmo indicado por tipo , que es un número entero / enumeración que apunta al tipo de algoritmos de clasificación utilizados.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.squeeze (self). Return a new view of self with all of the dimensions of length 1 removed from the shape.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.squeeze ( self ). Devuelve una nueva vista de sí mismo con todas las dimensiones de la longitud 1 eliminadas de la forma.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.std (self, axis, rtype). Return the standard deviation using data along axis converted to data type rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.std ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve la desviación estándar utilizando datos a lo largo del eje convertidos al tipo de datos rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.sum (self, axis, rtype). Return 1-d vector sums of elements in self along axis. Perform the sum after converting data to data type rtype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.sum ( self , axis , rtype ). Devuelve sumas vectoriales 1-d de elementos en self a lo largo del eje . Realice la suma después de convertir los datos al tipo de datos rtype .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.swapaxes (self, a1, a2). The returned array is a new view of the data in self with the given axes, a1 and a2, swapped.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.swapaxes ( self , a1 , a2 ). La matriz devuelta es una nueva vista de los datos en sí mismo con los ejes dados, a1 y a2 , intercambiados.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.take (self, indices, axis, ret, clipmode) except axis =None in Python is obtained by setting axis = NPY_MAXDIMS in C. Extract the items from self indicated by the integer-valued indices along the given axis. The clipmode argument can be NPY_RAISE, NPY_WRAP, or NPY_CLIP to indicate what to do with out-of-bound indices. The ret argument can specify an output array rather than having one created internally.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.take ( self , indices , axis , ret , clipmode ) excepto que axis = None en Python se obtiene estableciendo axis = NPY_MAXDIMS en C. Extrae los elementos de self indicados por los índices de valor entero a lo largo del eje dado . El argumento del modo de clip puede ser NPY_RAISE , NPY_WRAP o NPY_CLIP para indicar qué hacer con los índices fuera del límite. El argumento ret puede especificar una matriz de salida en lugar de tener una creada internamente.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.tobytes (self, order). Return the bytes of this array in a Python string.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.tobytes ( self , order ). Devuelve los bytes de esta matriz en una cadena de Python.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.tolist (self). Return a nested Python list from self.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.tolist ( self ). Devuelve una lista de Python anidada de self .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.trace (self, offset, axis1, axis2, rtype). Return the sum (using rtype as the data type of summation) over the offset diagonal elements of the 2-d arrays defined by axis1 and axis2 variables. A positive offset chooses diagonals above the main diagonal. A negative offset selects diagonals below the main diagonal.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.trace ( self , offset , axis1 , axis2 , rtype ). Devuelve la suma (usando rtype como el tipo de datos de suma) sobre los elementos diagonales de desplazamiento de las matrices 2-d definidas por las variables axis1 y axis2 . Un desplazamiento positivo elige diagonales por encima de la diagonal principal. Un desplazamiento negativo selecciona diagonales debajo de la diagonal principal.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.transpose (self, permute). Permute the axes of the ndarray object self according to the data structure permute and return the result. If permute is NULL, then the resulting array has its axes reversed. For example if self has shape
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.transpose ( self , permute ). Permuta los ejes del objeto ndarray self de acuerdo con la estructura de datos permute y devuelve el resultado. Si permute es NULL , entonces la matriz resultante tiene sus ejes invertidos. Por ejemplo, si el yo tiene forma

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to ndarray.view (self, dtype). Return a new view of the array self as possibly a different data-type, dtype, and different array subclass ptype.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a ndarray.view ( self , dtype ). Devuelve una nueva vista de la matriz self como posiblemente un tipo de datos diferente, dtype y una subclase ptype de matriz diferente .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to Py_BEGIN_ALLOW_THREADS except it uses NPY_ALLOW_THREADS to determine if the macro if replaced with white-space or not.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a Py_BEGIN_ALLOW_THREADS excepto que usa NPY_ALLOW_THREADS para determinar si la macro se reemplaza con espacios en blanco o no.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to Py_END_ALLOW_THREADS except it uses NPY_ALLOW_THREADS to determine if the macro if replaced with white-space or not.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a Py_END_ALLOW_THREADS excepto que usa NPY_ALLOW_THREADS para determinar si la macro se reemplaza con espacios en blanco o no.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to 1/2 * (np.exp(x) + np.exp(-x)) and np.cos(1j*x).
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a 1/2 * (np.exp(x) + np.exp(-x)) y np.cos(1j*x) .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to 1/2 * (np.exp(x) - np.exp(-x)) or -1j * np.sin(1j*x).
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a 1/2 * (np.exp(x) - np.exp(-x)) o -1j * np.sin(1j*x) .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to a.copy(order='K').
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a una a.copy(order='K') .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to divmod(x, 1) for positive x with the return values switched.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a divmod(x, 1) para x positivo con los valores de retorno cambiados.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to m[::-1,...]. Does not require the array to be two-dimensional.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente m[::-1,...] . No requiere que la matriz sea bidimensional.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to np.asarray(self).
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a np.asarray(self) .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to np.asarray(x).ravel()
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a np.asarray(x).ravel()

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to np.sin(x)/np.cos(x) element-wise.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a np.sin(x)/np.cos(x) elemento-sabio.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to np.sinh(x)/np.cosh(x) or -1j * np.tan(1j*x).
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a np.sinh(x)/np.cosh(x) o -1j * np.tan(1j*x) .

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to np.transpose(self) if self is real-valued.
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a np.transpose(self) si self tiene un valor real.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to sqrt(x1**2 + x2**2), element-wise. If x1 or x2 is scalar_like (i.e., unambiguously cast-able to a scalar type), it is broadcast for use with each element of the other argument. (See Examples)
trans-unit.target: Equivalente a sqrt(x1**2 + x2**2) , elemento-sabio. Si x1 o x2 es escalar_like (es decir, sin ambigüedad convertible a un tipo escalar), se transmite para su uso con cada elemento del otro argumento. (Ver ejemplos)

trans-unit.source: Even for contiguous arrays a stride for a given dimension arr.strides[dim] may be arbitrary if arr.shape[dim] == 1 or the array has no elements. It does not generally hold that self.strides[-1] == self.itemsize for C-style contiguous arrays or self.strides[0] == self.itemsize for Fortran-style contiguous arrays is true.
trans-unit.target: Incluso para matrices contiguas, un paso para una dimensión dada arr.strides[dim] puede ser arbitrario si arr.shape[dim] == 1 o la matriz no tiene elementos. Generalmente no se sostiene que self.strides[-1] == self.itemsize para matrices contiguas de estilo C o self.strides[0] == self.itemsize para matrices contiguas de estilo Fortran sea verdadero.

trans-unit.source: Even for contiguous arrays a stride for a given dimension arr.strides[dim] may be arbitrary if arr.shape[dim] == 1 or the array has no elements. It does not generally hold that self.strides[-1] == self.itemsize for C-style contiguous arrays or self.strides[0] == self.itemsize for Fortran-style contiguous arrays is true. The correct way to access the itemsize of an array from the C API is PyArray_ITEMSIZE(arr).
trans-unit.target: Incluso para matrices contiguas, un paso para una dimensión dada arr.strides[dim] puede ser arbitrario si arr.shape[dim] == 1 o la matriz no tiene elementos. Generalmente no se sostiene que self.strides[-1] == self.itemsize para matrices contiguas de estilo C o self.strides[0] == self.itemsize para matrices contiguas de estilo Fortran sea verdadero. La forma correcta de acceder al itemsize de elemento de una matriz desde la API de C es PyArray_ITEMSIZE(arr) .

trans-unit.source: Even though 0 occurs twice in the list of indices, the 0th element is only incremented once. This is because Python requires “a+=1” to be equivalent to “a = a + 1”.

trans-unit.source: Every Python module, extension module, or subpackage in the SciPy package directory should have a corresponding test_<name>.py file. Pytest examines these files for test methods (named test*) and test classes (named Test*).

trans-unit.source: Every module should have a docstring at the very top of the file. The module’s docstring may extend over multiple lines. If your docstring does extend over multiple lines, the closing three quotation marks must be on a line by itself, preferably preceded by a blank line.

Every ufunc calculation involves some overhead related to setting up the calculation. The practical significance of this overhead is that even though the actual calculation of the ufunc is very fast, you will be able to write array and type-specific code that will work faster for small arrays than the ufunc. In particular, using ufuncs to perform many calculations on 0-D arrays will be slower than other Python-based solutions (the silently-imported scalarmath module exists precisely to give array scalars the look-and-feel of ufunc based calculations with significantly reduced overhead).
trans-unit.target: Cada cálculo de la UFU implica algunos gastos generales relacionados con la configuración del cálculo.El significado práctico de esta sobrecarga es que aunque el cálculo real del ufunc es muy rápido,podrás escribir código específico de matrices y tipos que funcionará más rápido para matrices pequeñas que el ufunc.En particular,el uso de ufuncs para realizar muchos cálculos en matrices 0-D será más lento que otras soluciones basadas en Python (el módulo scalarmath importado silenciosamente existe precisamente para dar a los escalares de matrices el aspecto de los cálculos basados en ufunc con una sobrecarga significativamente reducida).

Extension modules that need to compile against NumPy should use this function to locate the appropriate include directory.

Extension modules were discussed in Writing an extension module. The most basic way to interface with compiled code is to write an extension module and construct a module method that calls the compiled code. For improved readability, your method should take advantage of the PyArg_ParseTuple call to convert between Python objects and C data-types. For standard C data-types there is probably already a built-in converter. For others you may need to write your own converter and use the "O&" format string which allows you to specify a function that will be used to perform the conversion from the Python object to whatever C-structures are needed.

trans-unit.source: F2PY Users Guide and Reference Manual

F2PY can be used either as a command line tool f2py or as a Python module numpy.f2py. While we try to install the command line tool as part of the numpy setup, some platforms like Windows make it difficult to reliably put the executable on the PATH. We will refer to f2py in this document but you may have to run it as a module:

F2PY compiles all sources and builds an extension module containing the wrappers. In building extension modules, F2PY uses numpy_distutils that supports a number of Fortran 77/90/95 compilers, including Gnu, Intel, Sun Fortre, SGI MIPSpro, Absoft, NAG, Compaq etc. compilers.
F2PY directive has the following form:
F2PY directives

F2PY generated interface is very flexible with respect to call-back arguments. For each call-back argument an additional optional argument <name>_extra_args is introduced by F2PY. This argument can be used to pass extra arguments to user provided call-back arguments.

F2PY generated wrapper functions accept (almost) any Python object as a string argument, str is applied for non-string objects. Exceptions are NumPy arrays that must have type code 'c' or '1' when used as string arguments.

F2PY generates wrappers to common blocks defined in a routine signature block. Common blocks are visible by all Fortran codes linked with the current extension module, but not to other extension modules (this restriction is due to how Python imports shared libraries). In Python, the F2PY wrappers to common blocks are fortran type objects that have (dynamic) attributes related to data members of common blocks. When accessed, these attributes return as NumPy array objects (multidimensional arrays are Fortran-contiguous) that directly link to data members in common blocks. Data members can be changed by direct assignment or by in-place changes to the corresponding array objects.
F2PY generates wrappers to all entry names using the signature of the routine block.
F2PY has basic support for Fortran 90 module allocatable arrays.
F2PY implements basic compatibility checks between related arguments in order to avoid any unexpected crashes.
F2PY may lower cases also in C expressions when scanning Fortran codes (see --[no]-lower option).

F2PY provides intent(inplace) attribute that would modify the attributes of an input array so that any changes made by Fortran routine will be effective also in input argument. For example, if one specifies intent(inplace) a (see below, how), then the example above would read:
F2PY reads a signature file and writes a Python C/API module containing Fortran/C/Python bindings.
F2PY supports calling Python functions from Fortran or C codes.
F2Py Guide

F2py allows you to automatically construct an extension module that interfaces to routines in Fortran 77/90/95 code. It has the ability to parse Fortran 77/90/95 code and automatically generate Python signatures for the subroutines it encounters, or you can guide how the subroutine interfaces with Python by constructing an interface-definition-file (or modifying the f2py-produced one).

trans-unit.source: FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) refers to a way the discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) can be calculated efficiently, by using symmetries in the calculated terms. The symmetry is highest when n is a power of 2, and the transform is therefore most efficient for these sizes.
trans-unit.target: FFT (Transformada rápida de Fourier) se refiere a una forma en que la Transformada de Fourier discreta (DFT) se puede calcular de manera eficiente, utilizando simetrías en los términos calculados. La simetría es mayor cuando n es una potencia de 2 y, por lo tanto, la transformada es más eficiente para estos tamaños.

Fill in a new Python type-object structure with pointers to new functions that will over-ride the default behavior while leaving any function that should remain the same unfilled (or NULL). The tp_name element should be different.

Fill in the tp_base member of the new type-object structure with a pointer to the (main) parent type object. For multiple-inheritance, also fill in the tp_bases member with a tuple containing all of the parent objects in the order they should be used to define inheritance. Remember, all parent-types must have the same C-structure for multiple inheritance to work properly.

trans-unit.source: Finally, if you detect a typo or an error in the documentation, or would like to suggest a different approach, you can also open an issue or submit a pull request with your suggestion. Keep in mind that changes fixing grammatical/spelling errors are welcome but not necessarily the highest priority. “Grammatical correctness” often gets confused with “style” which can result in unfruitful discussions that don’t necessarily improve anything. Changes that modify wording or rearrange phrasing without changing the technical content are discouraged. Finally, it is emphasized that v consists of the right (as in right-hand side) eigenvectors of a. A vector y satisfying dot(y.T, a) = z * y.T for some number z is called a left eigenvector of a, and, in general, the left and right eigenvectors of a matrix are not necessarily the (perhaps conjugate) transposes of each other.

Finally, the decision is made about how to execute the looping mechanism to ensure that all elements of the input arrays are combined to produce the output arrays of the correct type. The options for loop execution are one-loop (for contiguous, aligned, and correct data type), strided-loop (for non-contiguous but still aligned and correct data type), and a buffered loop (for mis-aligned or incorrect data type situations). Depending on which execution method is called for, the loop is then setup and computed.
trans-unit.target: Finalmente,se decide cómo ejecutar el mecanismo de bucle para asegurar que todos los elementos de las matrices de entrada se combinen para producir las matrices de salida del tipo correcto.Las opciones para la ejecución del bucle son un bucle (para tipos de datos contiguos,alineados y correctos),un bucle escalonado (para tipos de datos no contiguos pero aún alineados y correctos)y un bucle con búfer (para situaciones de tipos de datos mal alineados o incorrectos).Dependiendo del método de ejecución que se requiera,el bucle se configura y se calcula.

trans-unit.source: Fit a polynomial p(x) = p[0] * x**deg + ... + p[deg] of degree deg to points (x, y). Returns a vector of coefficients p that minimises the squared error in the order deg, deg-1, … 0.
trans-unit.target: Ajuste un polinomio p(x) = p[0] * x**deg + ... + p[deg] de grado deg a los puntos (x, y) . Devuelve un vector de coeficientes p que minimiza el error al cuadrado en el orden deg , deg-1 ,… 0 .

trans-unit.source: Fits using Chebyshev series are usually better conditioned than fits using power series, but much can depend on the distribution of the sample points and the smoothness of the data. If the quality of the fit is inadequate splines may be a good alternative.
trans-unit.target: Los ajustes que utilizan las series de Chebyshev suelen estar mejor condicionados que los que utilizan series de potencia,pero mucho puede depender de la distribución de los puntos de muestra y de la suavidad de los datos.Si la calidad del ajuste es inadecuada,las estrías pueden ser una buena alternativa.

trans-unit.source: Fits using Hermite series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the Hermite weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i])) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i])). The weight function is available as hermweight.

Fits using Hermite series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the Hermite weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i]) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]). The weight function is available as hermweight.
trans-unit.target: Los ajustes que utilizan la serie de Hermite son probablemente más útiles cuando los datos se pueden aproximar mediante sqrt(w(x)) * p(x) , donde w(x) es el peso de Hermite. En ese caso, el peso sqrt(w(x[i]) debe usarse junto con los valores de datos y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]) . La función de peso está disponible como hermweight .

trans-unit.source: Fits using HermiteE series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the HermiteE weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i])) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i])). The weight function is available as hermeweight.

Fits using HermiteE series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the HermiteE weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i]) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]). The weight function is available as hermeweight.
trans-unit.target: Los ajustes que utilizan la serie HermiteE son probablemente más útiles cuando los datos se pueden aproximar mediante sqrt(w(x)) * p(x) , donde w(x) es el peso de HermiteE. En ese caso, el peso sqrt(w(x[i]) debe usarse junto con los valores de datos y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]) . La función de peso está disponible como hermeweight .

trans-unit.source: Fits using Laguerre series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the Laguerre weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i])) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i])). The weight function is available as lagweight.

Fits using Laguerre series are probably most useful when the data can be approximated by sqrt(w(x)) * p(x), where w(x) is the Laguerre weight. In that case the weight sqrt(w(x[i]) should be used together with data values y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]). The weight function is available as lagweight.
trans-unit.target: Los ajustes que utilizan la serie de Laguerre son probablemente más útiles cuando los datos se pueden aproximar mediante sqrt(w(x)) * p(x) , donde w(x) es el peso de Laguerre. En ese caso, el peso sqrt(w(x[i]) debe usarse junto con los valores de datos y[i]/sqrt(w(x[i]) . La función de peso está disponible como lagweight .

trans-unit.source: Fits using Legendre series are usually better conditioned than fits using power series, but much can depend on the distribution of the sample points and the smoothness of the data. If the quality of the fit is inadequate splines may be a good alternative.
trans-unit.target: Los ajustes que utilizan las series de Legendre suelen estar mejor condicionados que los ajustes que utilizan series de potencia,pero mucho puede depender de la distribución de los puntos de muestra y de la suavidad de los datos.Si la calidad del ajuste es inadecuada,las estrías pueden ser una buena alternativa.

trans-unit.source: Following the header comes the array data. If the dtype contains Python objects (i.e. dtype.hasobject is True), then the data is a Python pickle of the array. Otherwise the data is the contiguous (either C- or Fortran-, depending on fortran_order) bytes of the array. Consumers can figure out the number of bytes by multiplying the number of elements given by the shape (noting that shape=() means there is 1 element) by dtype.itemsize.
trans-unit.target: Después del encabezado vienen los datos de la matriz. Si el dtype contiene objetos Python (es decir, dtype.hasobject is True ), entonces los datos son un encurtido Python de la matriz. De lo contrario, los datos son los bytes contiguos (ya sea C- o Fortran-, según fortran_order ) de la matriz. Los consumidores pueden calcular el número de bytes multiplicando el número de elementos dados por la forma (teniendo en cuenta que shape=() significa que hay 1 elemento) por dtype.itemsize .
